newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee stuck in narrow range, ends steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee stuck in narrow range, ends steady.

text.p: The Indian rupee was stuck in a narrow range and ended unchanged at 35.65/66 against the dollar in dull trading on Wednesday, dealers said.
"There was no movement -- rupee was at 35.65/66 through the day," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
The Reserve Bank of India supported the dollar by buying undisclosed amounts at 35.6550 rupees, dealers said.
Forward dollar eased with six-month annualised premia closing at 8.47 percent, down from the previous close of 8.64 percent on expectations of easing liquidity, dealers said.
